intro: Peucedanum teretifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. It typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is found in parts of Europe and Asia. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The leaves and seeds are also used in culinary applications, though caution is advised due to potential toxicity.
